title: Ticket #6544: Add GPUsMemoryUsage
description:
With #6477 complete, we have an infrastructure for, but no data about, GPUsMemoryUsage. This ticket covers two tasks:

  1. Add a peak memory usage report to condor_gpu_utilization.
  2. Verify that the plumbing all functions properly.

The first point should be relatively straightforward.

I've split the second point into basic tests and additional tests to mirror what happened with SUM metrics. The CI tests for this commit just need to test one PEAK metric with multiple resource instances.
remarks:
2018-Feb-02 10:21:33 by tlmiller:
Manual testing with multiple instances of the same type in partitionable slots has already found what appears to be consistent undercounting when both resources have nonzero usage.

[Recorded in ticket #6553 and subsequently fixed.]

2018-Feb-19 15:06:32 by tlmiller:
The basic tests here will also check both static and dynamic slots, as well as slot reuse.

2018-Feb-19 15:09:51 by tlmiller:
They will not, however, make use of DeferralTime to try to ensure that we hit each position in each sequence of memory usage reports; instead, we'll assume some randomness over the whole test suite and over time will do a thorough-enough test. This is because DeferralTime is implemented in the starter, and since the startd starts tracking usage once the starter is spawned, the reported peak usages can look impossible (since they can include peaks from before the job started). In real life, this won't be a problem unless the monitor in question is also misreporting.

2018-Feb-27 11:16:34 by tlmiller:
Should test new memory-usage probe on "the" 4-GPU machine.

2018-Mar-08 13:59:05 by tlmiller:
> Should test new memory-usage probe on "the" 4-GPU machine.

Done. Looks good.
